result.post: Ocean within the foreseeable future. In this review, we

result.pre: our current understanding of the most likely trajectory of the
result.post: sea-ice cover towards this state. Recent Findings The future

result.pre: towards this state. Recent Findings The future trajectory of the
result.post: sea-ice cover can be described through a deterministic component

result.pre: be described through a deterministic component arising primarily from future
result.post: emissions, and a chaotic component arising from internal variability.

result.pre: The deterministic component is expected to cause a largely ice-free
result.post: Ocean during summer for less than 2 ∘C global

result.pre: pre-industrial levels. To keep chances below 5 % that the
result.post: Ocean will largely be ice free in a given

result.pre: CO 2 emissions must remain below 500 Gt. Summary The
result.post: Ocean will become ice free during summer before mid-century

result.pre: Ocean will become ice free during summer before mid-century unless
result.post: emissions are rapidly reduced. Keywords Sea ice Arctic ocean

result.pre: unless greenhouse gas emissions are rapidly reduced. Keywords Sea ice
